item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza: All Quiztone Quiz Answers
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

As you work your way through every dense layer in Donkey Kong Bananza, you'll start to realize there are way, way more Banandium Gems than you expected to find. Whether it's uncovering them hiding in terrain or by solving clever puzzles to reach them, you'll be spending the majority of your time in the game tracking down these fruits. But you may not have anticipated needing to solve quizzes to get your hands on one, yet that's exactly what you'll have to do when you encounter a character named Quiztone.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • All Quiztone quiz answers in Donkey Kong Bananza
    • Hilltop Layer (SL200)
    • The Divide (SL400)
    • Resort Layer (SL800)
    • Racing Layer (SL1100)
    • Feast Layer (SL1400)
    • Planet Core (SL1606)
    • Ingot Isle Cave-In (SL10)

Quiztone shows up on multiple layers throughout Donkey Kong Bananza, and each encounter requires you to answer three questions to earn yourself a Banandium Gem. Though failing an answer isn't the end of the world, it does send you back to the beginning of his dialogue and forces you to re-answer any previous questions, which can be quite an annoyance. With that in mind, we've compiled all of the answers to Quiztone's quizzes to save you some time.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Donkey Kong Bananza GameSpot Review

All Quiztone quiz answers in Donkey Kong Bananza

You'll meet Quiztone seven times in Donkey Kong Bananza. Here are all the answers to his quizzes at each location.

Hilltop Layer (SL200)

  • Fossils
  • Your helmet
  • Throwable explosive

The Divide (SL400)

  • A magnet
  • A mixer
  • Health

Resort Layer (SL800)

  • Sunglasses
  • A juice bar
  • Coconuts

Racing Layer (SL1100)

  • A sauna
  • Eelings
  • Chunks of stone

Feast Layer (SL1400)

  • A giant speaker
  • Lighting equipment
  • A forest of nuggets

Planet Core (SL1606)

  • Seals
  • Powerful
  • Quiztone

Ingot Isle Cave-In (SL10)

Note: This Quiztone encounter can only happen after you beat the game. Afterward, this layer is repopulated with new Banandium Gems and characters.

  • A pickaxe
  • Banandium Chips
  • A bow tie

For more on Donkey Kong Bananza, check out how to get all Donkey Kong outfits and all Pauline outfits.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Explore The Lore Final Fantasy 16's World In This New Book
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Every mainline Final Fantasy game introduces its own lore and cast of characters to the franchise, and Final Fantasy XVI is no exception. Set in Valisthea, a world of magic, cruel gods, and powerful Eikons, Final Fantasy XVI features one of the most mature and gritty settings of the mainline series--but still offers the expansive worldbuilding and fantastical themes the series is known for, along with unique interpretations of Final Fantasy staples like Moogles, Chocobos, crystals, and more. If you want to learn more about Valisthea, you can revisit Final Fantasy XVI's setting with the upcoming Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI. As the title implies, this hardcover book will offer a deeper look at Final Fantasy XVI's many kingdoms, factions, and characters when it launches on March 31, 2026. Preorders are discounted to $39.80 (normally $45) at Amazon.

Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI

$39.80 (was $45) | Releases March 31, 2026

Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI is a massive 368-page hardcover book, explores everything from history to geography, music to cooking, and much more. Rather than simply being an encyclopedia cataloging the world of Valisthea, the book is written from the perspective of Valisthean scholar Harpocrates II Hyperboreos--a character you'll encounter frequently in Final Fantasy XVI--with numerous in-world journal entries, letters, and character conversations presented in illustrated full-color pages. Many of the entries are even penned by Final Fantasy XVI voice actors Ben Starr (Clive), Stewart Clarke (Dion), and Christopher York (Gav).

If you're looking to build your own Final Fantasy library, you can pair Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI with the The Art of Final Fantasy XVI. Published last year, the massive hardcover art book offers hundreds of pages of concept art, illustrations, and behind-the-scenes development materials for the game. The book is currently on sale for just $22, a nice 45% discount compared to its normal $40 price. There's also the Final Fantasy XVI Poster Art Collection book, which collects 33 posters featuring illustrations from the games, including pieces of the main characters, the Eikon summons, and more. Normally $35, it's on sale for $20.44.

Of course, the best way to experience Final Fantasy XVI's world first-hand is with the games itself. If you're on PS5, you can grab it for $24.88 (was $40) at Amazon, while PC players can get it for $50 on GMG. While this gets you the base game--which will take you through the main story featuring Clive's struggle to free the world of Valisthea from the control of the giant, magical Mothercrystals--Final Fantasy XVI has also received two paid DLC expansions, Echoes of the Fallen and The Rising Tide, that add additional side stories that flesh out the world with new characters, dungeons, side-quests, and unlockable abilities for Clive to master. These are available as separate purchases on PS5 via the PlayStation Store, while PC players can purchase the $70 Complete Edition, which includes the base game, both DLC chapters, and a few extra in-game items.

Final Fantasy XVI Book And Game Deals

Books

  • The Art of Final Fantasy XVI -- $22 ($40)
  • Final Fantasy XVI Poster Art Collection -- $20.44 ($35)
  • Logos: The World of Final Fantasy XVI -- $39.80 ($45) | Releases March 31, 2026

Games

  • Final Fantasy XVI (PS5) -- $24.88 ($40)
  • Final Fantasy XVI (PC) -- $50
  • Final Fantasy XVI: Complete Edition (PC) -- $70

item.title: EA Sports FC 26 Ultimate Edition Preorders Include 7-Day Early Access
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With most of the big soccer leagues and tournaments wrapping up their 2025 seasons, fans will have to wait until next year for their pro soccer fixes, but thankfully, EA Sports FC 26 drops on September 26 for PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, and PC, which should make the offseason a bit more bearable. Folks eager for the new entry in EA's annual soccer video game series can preorder the game now at multiple online retailers. Not only are there two editions to choose from, but there are some nice preorder bonuses if you reserve the game ahead of time, too.

EA Sports FC 26 Preorder Bonuses

Preordering any version of EA Sports FC 26 gets you the following bonuses:

  • 3 ICON Players for Manager Career
  • 5-Star Coach in Manager Career
  • 5-Star Youth Scout in Manager Career
  • Manager Live Challenge Content
  • 1 Archetype Unlock Consumable
  • 2 Double Archetypes XP Consumables
  • 92+ OVR ICON for EA Sports FC 25

These extras are offered with physical and digital preorders of the standard and Ultimate Editions of the game on all platforms.

Along with these universal preorder bonuses, there are also a few retailer-specific extras available, too. Best Buy is offering a free $10 gift card with all physical edition preorders. GameStop will also be offering an exclusive preorder gift, though the details on what exactly this is have yet to be revealed.

There's also the EA Sports FC 26 Ultimate Edition, which offers a selection of exclusive preorder bonuses, including up to severn days of early access to the full game starting September 19, plus a list of in-game items outlined below. Note that preorders for the Ultimate Edition are only open until August 26, so preorder before then.

EA Sports FC 26 Ultimate Edition preorder bonuses:

  • EVO that boosts a player's shooting to 99 in EA Sports FC 25
  • 1 of 5 Player Pick 93+ OVR ICON Player Item for EA Sports FC 25
  • ICON Player Item for EA Sports FC 26
  • 1 of 15 ICON Player Item for EA Sports FC 26

EA Sports FC 26 Standard Edition

$70 | Releases September 26

The EA Sports FC 26 standard edition includes the base game plus any eligible preorder bonuses (including retailer-specific extras, depending on where you purchase the game). Physical copies of the PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, Nintendo Switch, and Nintendo Switch 2 versions are available at Amazon, Best Buy, and GameStop. We expect to see it at other retailers, such as Target and Walmart, soon.

Note that the Switch 2 edition is a Game Key-Card release, meaning none of the game data is stored on the cartridge itself, and it instead works as a physical key to unlock and download the digital version to your console. Like other Game Key-Cards, you'll be able to trade in or let others borrow the game to play on their system.

EA Sports FC 26 Ultimate Edition

$100 | Releases September 19

If you want to start playing FC 26 as soon as possible, spend the extra $30 for the Ultimate Edition, which lets you play the full game up to seven days early starting September 19. It comes with everything in the standard edition, the FC 26 Season 1 Premium Pass, version-exclusive preorder bonuses, and an assortment of premium in-game items, including:

  • 6,000 FC Points over two months (4,500 on Switch)
  • Additional FUT Player Evolution Slots (2 additional)

Note that this is a digital-only version of the game available for consoles and PC. Preorders are available on the PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, Switch eShop, Steam, and the EA Origin app.

item.title: Ubisoft Addresses The Stop Killing Games Movement
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Stop Killing Games movement hits a bit closer for Ubisoft than some companies in part because the publisher is facing a lawsuit for shutting down the servers for The Crew last year. During an Ubisoft shareholders meeting, CEO Yves Guillemot was asked to address the goals of Stop Killing Games and he replied that games aren't meant to "last forever."

Ubisoft shared the text of the shareholders meeting (via Game File), Guillemot said, "You provide a service, but nothing is written in stone and at some point the service may be discontinued. Nothing is eternal. And we are doing our best to make sure that things go well for all players and buyers, because obviously support for all games cannot last forever. But that's an issue that we're working on. That's something that the industry at large is working on, to minimize impact on players. But clearly that's something you need to factor in."

Stop Killing Games was started last year by YouTube host Ross Scott in the aftermath of Ubisoft's decision to sunset The Crew. The movement challenges the legality and ethics of publishers' decisions to shut down games that have previously been sold to consumers. The EU lobbying association Video Games Europe recently responded that Stop Killing Games' proposals to keep older games alive "would curtail developer choice by making these video games prohibitively expensive to create."

Ubisoft isn't the only company taking older games offline. BioWare's Anthem will be shutting down in January 2026. Last year, Sony's Concord only lasted a few weeks before it was also shut down.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ubisoft-addresses-the-stop-killing-games-movement/1100-6533318/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Marvel Snap Goes Worldwide With Golden Gauntlet Championship Tournament
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Oh, snap! Second Dinner has officially announced the Marvel Snap: Golden Gauntlet World Championship Series, a global tournament initiative launching on August 9, 2025. This free-to-enter competition is open to all players regardless of rank or experience and is aimed at bringing together the community and showcasing players' creativity. The series will be broadcast live on the game's official Twitch and YouTube channels.

Registration links will be shared on the official Discord ahead of each event, along with full rules, format, and support in dedicated channels.

The Golden Gauntlet Series will include three regional "Open Qualifier" tournaments, leading up to a global finals event in November called the Golden Gauntlet Worlds. Each regional event will follow a standardized format: Six rounds of Swiss-style playing (a fixed number of rounds, with pairings based on performance rather than elimination), followed by a top 16 single-elimination bracket, with prizes awarded to the top finishers.

After that, players who end those rounds with a 5-1 record or better will earn a spot in the final event. These qualifiers are scheduled for August, September, and October, each focusing on different global regions, ensuring as many players as possible.

Aland Failde, SVP of marketing at Second Dinner, emphasized that the tournament is a way to give back to fans and creators who have shaped the game's journey.

"From day one, Marvel Snap has been shaped by its players, and the Golden Gauntlet is our way of supporting and amplifying that passion," Failde said in a statement. "Huge shoutout to Game On Events for helping us host this event and to all the incredible community members who've helped bring this to life--this series wouldn't exist without their dedication, creativity, and love for the game."

Snap players might remember when the game went temporarily offline this past January due to the implementation of the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act (PAFACA). The legislation banned software owned or published by ByteDance, which owns the game's then-publisher Nuverse. The restrictions were later removed, and the developers announced that they would work with US company Skystone Games to bring publishing duties in-house.

Similarly, Matthew R.--also known for his gamertag ItsGuestGaming--co-founder of Game On Events, highlighted the tournament's evolution from grassroots efforts to a full-fledged world championship.

Our goal with this series is to bring the community together to celebrate Marvel Snap's competitive scene while showcasing the fast, high-stakes nature of its matches," he said. "It's been exciting to watch tournaments grow from grassroots events to the Golden Gauntlet World Championship Series. Whether you've been playing for two months or two years, we're thrilled to host a tournament that honors Marvel Snap's amazing community."

The grand finale, Golden Gauntlet Worlds, will take place on November 8, 2025, featuring over 300 qualified players from the three open tournaments. This final event will consist of nine rounds of Swiss play, culminating in a Top 16 playoff to determine the ultimate champion.

As of now, there are no cards banned, but it wouldn't surprise me if they treat this like High Voltage-style and ban cards like Galactus and Magik just to speed things along.

The tournament will start a week after the last of the Fantastic Four: First Steps cards drop, giving players some time to decide if their already perfect deck could be better.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/marvel-snap-goes-worldwide-with-golden-gauntlet-championship-tournament/1100-6533317/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
